snippet.textDisplay: Jin vs Margulis. This battle scene was so awesome to me as a child, If there was anything that stood out to me in this series besides mechs and kos-mos it was this song and that scene. I hope one day I can wake up and hear Sakurai-san talk about xenosaga. Namco has no reps besides pac-man. Kos-mos would be perfect.

snippet.textDisplay: Is it just me, or does she switch between Latin and Japanese?

snippet.textDisplay: It's Kajiura's own "language" of sorts called Kajiurago/Kajiuran/Kajiuraese for her compositions. It's made of Italian, Latin, some Japanese and English. It has no real meaning.
snippet.textOriginal: It's Kajiura's own "language" of sorts called Kajiurago/Kajiuran/Kajiuraese for her compositions. It's made of Italian, Latin, some Japanese and English. It has no real meaning.

snippet.textDisplay: I've been trying for years to figure that out.  I'm almost convinced it doesn't have a meaning.  If you figure out Jr.'s theme, I'd like to know too.  XDD
snippet.textOriginal: I've been trying for years to figure that out.  I'm almost convinced it doesn't have a meaning.  If you figure out Jr.'s theme, I'd like to know too.  XDD

snippet.textDisplay:
3:00 to 3:06 is the best 6 seconds of gaming 

I can imagine it playing in the background when Neo fights Morpheus. 

Or when Jason Bourne does Jason Bourne things.

Or that time when I fought Bruce Lee in my dream and he intentionally let the fight drag on till I fell over. On a New York skyscraper with Spider-Man chilling with Jesus.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: @Lifelessdummy we may have not gotten six games, but the trilogy has a fully fleshed beginning, middle and end.
snippet.textOriginal: @Lifelessdummy we may have not gotten six games, but the trilogy has a fully fleshed beginning, middle and end.

snippet.textDisplay:
"There will be six episodes planned in all, all of which are divided into three major parts. I already have the story plotted until the middle of episode five in my mind, but certain ideas may be perceived as old-fashioned as time goes, so we'll try to be flexible to changes."
- Tetsuya Takahashi (interview with GameSpot, Jun 8, 2001)
snippet.textOriginal:
"There will be six episodes planned in all, all of which are divided into three major parts. I already have the story plotted until the middle of episode five in my mind, but certain ideas may be perceived as old-fashioned as time goes, so we'll try to be flexible to changes."
- Tetsuya Takahashi (interview with GameSpot, Jun 8, 2001)

snippet.textDisplay:
WTF That is just too weird! I listen to music while I sleep, so today I put on my VGM list and during my daily nap I happened to wake up while this song was playing and as soon as I opened my eyes, all I could here was some chick screaming "Balsamic! Garlic Yummy Yum! Balsamic Garlic Yummy Yee!" I know it's a bit different...but still it's rather funny =P

On a side note, this is probably the best song ever to wake up to. Really gets you going.

snippet.textDisplay:
Jin in green reminds me of CITAN UZUKI from XenoGears. 
then again the creator of this game left Square after finishing XenoGears to form Monolith Soft and make the XenoSaga trilogy which was originally going to be a 5 game series. 
Monolith Soft is now mostly owned by Nintendo, and they released XenoBlade for the Wii. I've heard that game is fantastic.
snippet.textOriginal:
Jin in green reminds me of CITAN UZUKI from XenoGears. 
then again the creator of this game left Square after finishing XenoGears to form Monolith Soft and make the XenoSaga trilogy which was originally going to be a 5 game series. 
Monolith Soft is now mostly owned by Nintendo, and they released XenoBlade for the Wii. I've heard that game is fantastic.

snippet.textDisplay: this series is one of the greatest games to ever exist.  the whole series was aamzing, the story of two was aamzing.  it didnt progress all that much honestly but it gave an enormous amount of backstory.  the only serious flaw i found with two is the battle system.  i found myself looking forward to boss fights because boss fights were easier than random encounters honestly.  the damage ratio your characters were capable of was miserable and against a healing enemy?  *shudders*
snippet.textOriginal: this series is one of the greatest games to ever exist.  the whole series was aamzing, the story of two was aamzing.  it didnt progress all that much honestly but it gave an enormous amount of backstory.  the only serious flaw i found with two is the battle system.  i found myself looking forward to boss fights because boss fights were easier than random encounters honestly.  the damage ratio your characters were capable of was miserable and against a healing enemy?  *shudders*
